data.title: Great pizza
data.text: I come here with my teenage daughter for pizza. Staff is friendly and the pizza is really, really good.  fresh and no nonsense.

data.title: Pretty Amazing
data.text: I had written a review a couple of weeks ago about another pizza place thinking that it was about as good as it gets.  Maybe not!  Dinner at Fix last night was pretty amazing.  Starting with the white sangria - better than anything I had in Spain or Portugal - then the truffle fries, a Up In Smoke pizza (I asked to change out the smoked mozzarella for fresh - no problem), and finish with the donuts.  The group around the table couldn't decide which was better.  Friendly staff.  Nothing fancy about the decor but ample seating for a place that may specialize in take out/delivery. Will definitely return.

data.title: Great little pizza place
data.text: Excellent , Excellent !!! Wonderful service, friendly staff.  Amazing pizza, fresh dough and fresh ingridients. Love the decor with two steel oven pizzas very cozy environment.

data.title: Not the same
data.text: Fix was a true authentic Italian pizza place when it opened.  The owner came from Italy with a dream to build a successful restaurant.  It was everything you could want but something has happened recently that soured us forever.  Whether it is new owners, new cook or new servers, it just doesn't work anymore.  My order was screwed up, they baked another pizza and that was equally screwed up.  The wine was bitter and so was our impression.  Too bad, it could have been a winner.

data.title: Fabulous Pizza!
data.text: First visit but will not be the last!  Great pizza and some unique combinations for tomato or white sauce lovers.  The Five Boroughs has fresh tomato slices, roasted eggplant, red onion, and slices of seasoned meatballs on red sauce.  The Fifth Avenue has prosciutto, arugula, and white truffle oil on a white sauce.  The crust is thin, but not super thin, and tastes incredible!  The red sangria goes down WAY too easy and is very flavorful without being too sweet.

data.title: Good pizza
data.text: I like their food. Pizza is tasty, not anticos, but tasty. Only complaint is that they often burn the edges of the crust. That's not tasty and never has the pizza been redone Bc of that. I want to eat the crust, too, so watch it, or you'll lose customers.

data.title: What Happened?
data.text:
I was very happy when Fix opened its doors in downtown Roswell. Finally a real Napolitan pizza with fresh quality Mozarella, very similar to Antico Pizza in downtown, except this is 5 minutes drive....

Well...that didn't last long.... we just visited the place and experienced disappointment. 

Starting with the dough, which instead of the amazing one they previously had, now is something that looks, feels and taste as one of these processed fake dough you get at theme parks, through the tomato sauce and the cheese.

Something fundemental has changed in this place....and it's not a good one. Not sure if the management or owners are different but I don't think we will ever go back. Too sad to see this happening to a good place.

data.title: "A Must Try Pizza"
data.text: Get your Pizza Fix here for sure, Fresh, great crust, and plenty of choices for all. Service was friendly and attentive. Make sure you try a desert.

data.title: Unusual and delicious pizzas
data.text: Enjoyed two pizzas here, will go back to try other flavors!  The crust was perfect, no soggy middle, sauce was excellent and the service was really good, even got to sample a cheese that I hadn't heard of.   Looking forward to going back.

data.title: Fantastically Fresh Pizza
data.text: Stopped in one rainy evening with the family. It was early so we were able to order and receive our food quickly. I had a Caesar salad. My husband and I shared the 12" fifth avenue. If I didn't have the salad we probably should have gotten two pizzas. There is a larger pizza but for carry out only. The kids shared a cheese pizza. There wasn't any pizza left over! The ingredients were fresh and the dough amazing. If we lived closer I would definitely do take out all the time.

data.title: A Good Fix
data.text: Fast, great pizza lunch. "Make you own recipe" or pick a house special--you're a winner every way. Industrial strength ovens and a vintage dough with fresh toppings make for a tasty pie. Close to cheap valet parking--use it.

data.title: Could be the best pie in Atlanta!
data.text: Growing up in NJ & NY I would like to think I know a little something about pizza😋 this place ROCKS! The dough and sauce are top notch. I fact we went two Friday's in a row. You will not be disappointed.

data.title: Real Italian Pizza
data.text:
Italian owner and he is the chief...enough said!

The crust is amazing... fresh ingredients and good pricing.

data.title: Best Pizza in Roswell
data.text: This is the best pizza in Roswell, by far! The service was also fantastic. However, the pizzas are small and a bit pricey. I had no problem with the size of the pizzas, but my boyfriend is a "good eater" and was disappointed when the large pizza came out. Overall though, the taste makes up for the size. Very good.

data.title: One of the best pizza's we have had
data.text: We shared a salad and a margarita pizza with peperoni.  Both were delicious.  They offer pizzas with listed ingredients or “build your own”.  They have seating on a back brick patio area.  The staff were all very friendly and professional.

data.title: Best Pizza I have EVER had!
data.text: I am from Chicago and like deep dish....sometimes.....With that said, I have been to NY and Italy many many times and this is by far the best pizza I have ever had.  It starts with the 900+ degree oven and the ingredients.  Everything about this establishment is top notch.  If you are in Atlanta, GO HERE!  You will not regret it.

data.title: Great Pizza
data.text: This pizzeria is in the heart of the historic district of downtown Roswell and is fabulous! The pizzas are so good and made with fresh toppings and seem more healthy to eat than other ones that I've had at the franchise restaurants. The salads are great as well.

data.title: Delivering Real Pizza In Roswell
data.text: We mostly call Real Fix for delivery because the pizza and salads are fantastic.  It is so nice to get a decent pizza delivered with quality ingredients.  Not having to settle for grease or chain pizza is such a welcome change.  The Bianca is fantastic with confit mushrooms but all the pizza and toppings are fantastic.  You can't go wrong with The Real Fix.

data.title: excellent pizza
data.text: I ate lunch at this pizzeria this week. The pies were basically individual size and delicious. The one I recommend is fugedabout it (sorry my spelling is wrong, but that is the name phonetically). The service was fast and the server was very attentive to us.

data.title: The Best "Real" Pie on the Northside of the ️ATL!
data.text:
The Best "Real" Pie on the Northside of the ️ATL!
Yes the "Trifecta"
Great Food!
Great Service!
Great Atmosphere!

And dog friendly🐾🐾
